Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: LATE PERIOD (not after); NEW KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Fragmentary sandstone with incised motifs
Description: Rectangular fragmentary block of sandstone, parallelepiped. There are incised motifs (1 mm deep and 2 mm wide) on one of the two surfaces. A series of lines depicting very schematic animals (?) is surrounded by a crudely incised frame. The exact utilisation of this object could not be determined. Perhaps it was a decorative element or even a mould.
